1. In the south of England, summers used to be warm but now temperatures can often reach as high as
1234°C.Summers are increasing hotter.
Summers are becoming hotter.
Summers are going up.

2. The price of a passport used to be £50. It is now £66.The price of a passport is decreasing.
The price of a passport is deteriorating.
The price of a passport is increasing.

3. It’s official! Films this year last on average two hours fifteen minutes. This is up 10% from last year.Films are getting longer.
Films are getting better.
Films are going up.

4. 22% of rubbish comes from food packaging. It is predicted that this will be 25% in two years’ time
12unless we do something about it.The amount of food packaging is improving.
The amount of food packaging is rising.
The amount of food packaging is getting better.

5. Violent crimes went down last year with only 15,000 violent crimes reported. This compares with
12 22,000 in 2005. The number of violent crimes is falling.
The number of violent crimes is getting worse.
The number of violent crimes is becoming less dangerous.

6. Unfortunately there has been a big slow down in the economy of 10% in the last year.The economy is rising.
The economy is improving.
The economy is getting worse.

7. Dan Koster, a US web designer, has noticed that 15% of his 200 CDs can no longer be played.His CDs are decreasing.
His CDs are falling.
His CDs are deteriorating.

8. The old Nissan Micra cars were much smaller than modern Nissan Micras.Nissan Micras are increasing.
